intro: Primula sorachiana f. candida, commonly known as the white-flowered primrose, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its clustered basal leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The flowers of this cultivar are predominantly white, with a subtle pink or pale yellow hue at the base, creating a striking visual contrast. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. This form is a natural variant of Primula sorachiana, exhibiting unique floral characteristics that make it a prized addition to botanical collections.
